properties.description: ingestao de tabela com suporte ao dinamica range
alternativa para o dynamic range, quando o banco nao oferece suporte ao dynamic range, essa estrategia é interessante para cargas historicas
alternativa para o dynamic range, quando o banco nao oferece suporte ao dynamic range, essa estrategia é interessante para cargas historicas

sqlReaderQuery.value:
SELECT max(mostRecentDateTime) as mostRecentDateTime FROM controller.water_mark
WHERE tableName = 'SalesLT.SalesOrderDetail'

SELECT count(*) as hasRows FROM SalesLT.SalesOrderDetail
WHERE  ModifiedDate > '@{variables('water_mark')}'

SELECT max(ModifiedDate) as mostRecentDateTime
FROM  SalesLT.SalesOrderDetail

typeProperties.script:
source(output(
		ProductID as integer,
		Name as string,
		ProductNumber as string,
		Color as string,
		StandardCost as decimal(19,4),
		ListPrice as decimal(19,4),
		Size as string,
		Weight as decimal(8,2),
		ProductCategoryID as integer,
		ProductModelID as integer,
		SellStartDate as timestamp,
		SellEndDate as timestamp,
		DiscontinuedDate as timestamp,
		ThumbNailPhoto as binary,
		ThumbnailPhotoFileName as string,
		rowguid as string,
		ModifiedDate as timestamp
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false,
	format: 'parquet') ~> readBronzeProduct
readBronzeProduct derive(ModifiedDateSilver = fromUTC(currentTimestamp(), 'GMT-3'),
		Color = case(isNull(Color), 'NOT INFORMED', upper(Color))) ~> NewColumns
NewColumns sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'parquet',
	umask: 0022,
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	mapColumn(
		ProductID,
		Name,
		ProductNumber,
		Color,
		StandardCost,
		ListPrice,
		Size,
		Weight,
		ProductCategoryID,
		ProductModelID,
		SellStartDate,
		SellEndDate,
		DiscontinuedDate,
		ThumbNailPhoto,
		ThumbnailPhotoFileName,
		rowguid,
		ModifiedDateSource = ModifiedDate,
		ModifiedDateSilver
	)) ~> WriteProductSilver
